entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:57PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW LIKELY TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... An area of low pressure will bring strong winds and widespread precipitation to much of Southcentral Alaska from late Tuesday through late Wednesday. Strong winds are expected from the Matanuska Valley southward through the Cook Inlet. Winds gusting
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; East Turnagain Arm; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 06 at 5:23PM AKST until November 08 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 15 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, reducing visibility to one quarter mile at times in blowing snow.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 3:28PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STORM FORCE LOW FOR MID WEEK... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska will bring a storm force front to the panhandle for the middle of the week. This system will bring increased winds along the outer coast. Wind gusts could range from 40 to 60 mph. Forecast guidance today continues to show a strong front impacting the area Wednesday morning to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 06 at 8:01PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Downstream flow on the Saint Johns River near Astor remains hindered due to persistent northerly winds and tides. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 07 at 1:39AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZING RAIN MAY IMPACT TRAVEL THIS MORNING... A wintry mix of freezing rain and snow is going to move across the north central portions of North Dakota this morning, leading to possible icy conditions on roadways.
